rlexer 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Scanner Class

Source: R/scanner.R
Scanner.Rd

This class is designed for lexical analysis, converting a source string into a list of tokens.

Public fields

source

The source code as a string to be scanned.

tokens

A list to store the tokens generated from the source code.

start

The index of the first character in the current lexeme being scanned.

current

The index of the current character being scanned.

line

The current line number in the source code.

Methods

Method new()

Usage

Scanner$new(source)

Arguments

source

Scan Tokens

Scans the source code and generates a list of tokens.

Method scanTokens()

Usage

Scanner$scanTokens()

Returns

A list of tokens. Scan a Single Token

Scans and identifies the next token in the source code.

Method scanToken()

Usage

Scanner$scanToken()

Returns

The next token. Scan Identifier

Scans and identifies an identifier token.

Method identifier()

Usage

Scanner$identifier()

Returns

The identifier token. Scan Number

Scans and identifies a numeric token.

Method number()

Usage

Scanner$number()

Returns

The numeric token.

Scan String

Scans and identifies a string token.

Method string()

Usage

Scanner$string()

Returns

The string token.

Scan String

Scans and identifies a string token. Match Character

Checks if the next character matches the expected character.

Method match()

Usage

Scanner$match(expected)

Arguments

expected

The expected character.

Returns

TRUE if the next character matches the expected character, FALSE otherwise. Peek

Returns the current character without advancing the scanner.

Method peek()

Usage

Scanner$peek()

Returns

The current character. Peek Next

Returns the next character without advancing the scanner.

Method peekNext()

Usage

Scanner$peekNext()

Returns

The next character. Check if Alpha

Checks if the character is an alphabetical character.

Method isAlpha()

Usage

Scanner$isAlpha(c)

Arguments

c

The character to check.

Returns

TRUE if the character is alphabetical, FALSE otherwise. Check if AlphaNumeric

Checks if the character is alphanumeric.

Method isAlphaNumeric()

Usage

Scanner$isAlphaNumeric(c)

Arguments

c

The character to check.

Returns

TRUE if the character is alphanumeric, FALSE otherwise. Check if Digit

Checks if the character is a digit.

Method isDigit()

Usage

Scanner$isDigit(c)

Arguments

c

The character to check.

Returns

TRUE if the character is a digit, FALSE otherwise. Check if At End

Checks if the scanner has reached the end of the source code.

Method isAtEnd()

Usage

Scanner$isAtEnd()

Returns

TRUE if the scanner is at the end of the source code, FALSE otherwise. Advance

Advances the scanner to the next character.

Method advance()

Usage

Scanner$advance()

Returns

The next character. Add Token

Adds a new token to the list of tokens.

Method addToken()

Usage

Scanner$addToken(type, literal = NULL)

Arguments

type

The type of the token.

literal

The literal value of the token (optional).

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

Scanner$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
